text: Ernest Gilbert Broglio (; August 27, 1935 â€“ July 16, 2019) was an American professional baseball pitcher. He played for the St. Louis Cardinals and Chicago Cubs of Major League Baseball from 1959 to 1966. He was born in Berkeley, California. Broglio was best known as the "other player" in the controversial trade that sent future Baseball Hall of Fame outfielder Lou Brock from the Cubs to the Cardinals in June 1964. Broglio died on July 16, 2019 from cancer in San Jose, California at the age of 83. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Sportspeople from Berkeley, California
